JGAL

Class GAL_Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • JGAL.GAL_Util

  • public class GAL_Util
extends java.lang.Object
    Group of methods that are usefull for the creation of an Genetic Algorithm

    • Method Detail

      • concatArrays

        public static <T> T[] concatArrays(T[] array1,
                   T[] array2,
                   T[] type)
        Concatenate two arrays of the same type and return it as an new array.

        If the third parameter is big enough to store the return, it will be stored there; otherwise a new array will be created.

        Parameters:
        array1 - One of the arrays to concatenate.
        array2 - The other one of the arrays to concatenate.
        type - The class of the copy to be returned.
        Returns:
        The result of concatenating the array1 with the array2

      • concatArrays

        public static <T> T[] concatArrays(T[][] multiArray,
                   T[] type)
        Concatenate many arrays of the same type and return it as an new array.

        If the second parameter is big enough to store the return, it will be stored there; otherwise a new array will be created.

        Parameters:
        multiArray - All the arrays that will be concatenated.
        type - The class of the copy to be returned.
        Returns:
        The result of concatenating all the arrays in multiArray

      • divideAt

        public static <T> T[][] divideAt(T[] array,
                 int pos,
                 T[][] type)
        Split an array of any type at a position given by the second parameter.

        If the third parameter is big enough to store the return, it will be stored there; otherwise a new array will be created.

        Parameters:
        array - The array that will be splitted.
        pos - The position where the array will be splitted.
        type - The class of the copy to be returned.
        Returns:
        An array of 2 arrays, where the first one has the element from 0 to pos and the second one has the elements from pos to array.length

      • extractFrom

        public static <T> T[][] extractFrom(T[] array,
                    int number,
                    T[][] type)
        Split an array of any type, by selecting randomly a number of elements to be part of the second array and the rest the first array.

        If the third parameter is big enough to store the return, it will be stored there; otherwise a new array will be created.

        Parameters:
        array - The array that will get the extraction.
        number - The number of elements that will be extracted..
        type - The class of the copy to be returned.
        Returns:
        An array of 2 arrays, where the first one has the original array with the extraction and the second one the elements that were extracted

      • orderBy

        public static <T> void orderBy(T[] array,
               T[] array2,
               int[] order)
        Orders the first array into the second one by using the third one as the ordening base.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be ordered.
        array2 - The array where the result will be saved. It must be at least the same size than the first array.
        order - An int array where each position indicates the new position into array2. As Example. order[2]= 4 means than the 4th position of array must be in the 2nd position of array2.

      • shuffle

        public static <T> void shuffle(T[] array)
        Shuffle an array
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be shuffled
